Dialog.Talk: “When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable.” ― Jess C. Scott, The Intern
“I demolish my bridges behind me...then there is no choice but to move forward” ― Fridtjof Nansen
“When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this - you haven't.” ― Thomas A. Edison
“But just because you bury something, that doesn’t mean it stops existing.” ― Jenny Han, We'll Always Have Summer
“You shouldn't throw stones if you live in a glass house and if you got a glass jaw, you should watch yo mouth: cause I'll break yo face.” ― 50 Cent
“Make your lives a masterpiece, you only get one canvas.” ― E.A. Bucchianeri, Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
“You've got a lot of choices. If getting out of bed in the morning is a chore and you're not smiling on a regular basis, try another choice.” ― Steven D. Woodhull
“And you'd think that killing people would make them like you, but it doesn't. It just- it just makes them dead.” ― Joe Walker
A loving heart is the truest wisdom. -- Charles Dickens
Accidents will happen -- George Colman
It takes two to tangle. -- unknown
Love is often the fruit of marriage. -- French (on marriage)
Love isn't love until you give it away. -- John H. MacDonald Jr.
Not all who make love, make marriages. -- Russian (on marriage)
One who marries for love alone will have bad days but good nights. -- Egyptian (on marriage)
"There is only one kind of love, but there are thousands of different copies." ~ French Proverb
"Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love" ~ Albert Einstein
"A man falls in love through his eyes, a woman through her ears." ~ Woodrow Wyatt
"I was nauseous and tingly all over. I was either in love or I had smallpox." ~ Woody Allen
"A guy knows he's in love when he loses interest in his car for a couple of days." ~ Tim Allen
"I am a marvelous housekeeper. Every time I leave a man I keep his house." ~ Zsa Zsa Gabor
"Love is what makes two people sit in the middle of a bench when there is plenty of room at both the ends." ~ Unknown
"Marriage is the triumph of imagination over intelligence. Second marriage is the triumph of hope over experience." ~ Samuel Johnson
"This is true love! Do you think this happens everyday?" ~ The Princess Bride
"Love means never having to say you're sorry." ~ Love Story
"Don't forget I'm just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her." ~ Notting Hill
"It was a million tiny little things that, when you added them all up, they meant we were supposed to be together... and I knew it." ~ Sleepless In Seattle
"The truth is... I gave my heart away a long time ago, my whole heart... and I never really got it back." ~ Sweet Home Alabama
"The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return." ~ Moulin Rouge
"Love cannot be found where it doesn't exist, nor can it be hidden where it truly does." ~ Kissing a Fool
"You are what I never knew I always wanted." ~ Fools Rush In
"Don't cry when the sun is gone, because the tears won't let you see the stars." ~ Violeta Parra
"When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us." ~ Alexander Graham Bell
"To fall in love is awfully simple, but to fall out of love is simply awful." ~ Bess Myerson
"The saddest thing in the world, is loving someone who used to love you." ~ Anonymous
"It takes a minute to like someone, and hour to love someone, but to forget someone takes a lifetime." ~ Anonymous
